MATUR Docs¶

Azimuthal Integration¶

This file includes functions and classes essential for azimuthal integration

initialize_azimuthal_integrator_df(pixel_size, center_column, center_row, wavelength, sample_distance_mm)¶

Initializes or gets a cached azimuthal integrator with the given parameters.

Parameters:

  • pixel_size (float) – The size of a pixel on the detector, in meters.

  • center_column (float) – The column index of the center point for integration.

  • center_row (float) – The row index of the center point for integration.

  • wavelength (float) – The wavelength of the incident X-ray beam, in angstroms.

  • sample_distance_mm (float) – The sample-to-detector distance, in millimeters.

Returns:

  • pyFAI.azimuthalIntegrator.AzimuthalIntegrator: An instance of the PyFAI AzimuthalIntegrator.

initialize_azimuthal_integrator_poni(file)¶

Initializes or gets a cached azimuthal integrator with the given parameters.

Parameters:

file (str) – Path to the poni file.

Returns:

  • pyFAI.azimuthalIntegrator.AzimuthalIntegrator: An instance of the PyFAI AzimuthalIntegrator.

perform_azimuthal_integration(row: Series, npt=256, mask=None, mode='1D', calibration_mode='dataframe', poni_dir=None)¶

Perform azimuthal integration on a single row of a DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • row (pandas.Series) –

    A row from a pandas DataFrame, expected to contain the following columns:

    • measurement_data (array_like): A 2D array containing the measurement data.

    • center (tuple): A tuple of two floats representing the center coordinates (y, x) for the integration.

    • wavelength (float): The wavelength of the incident X-ray beam, in nanometers.

    • calculated_distance (float): The calculated distance from the sample to the detector, in meters.

    • pixel_size (float): The size of a pixel on the detector, in micrometers.

    • interpolation_q_range (tuple or None, optional): A tuple (q_min, q_max) specifying the range of q values for interpolation, where q is the momentum transfer, in reciprocal nanometers. If not provided, the full q range will be used.

    • azimuthal_range (tuple or None, optional): A tuple (min_deg, max_deg) specifying the range of degrees for integration. Degrees are in a range from -180 to 180.

    OR

    • calibration_measurement_id (int): Integer associated with the ID of a specific calibration, used to name the poni file.

    • measurement_data (array_like): A 2D array containing the measurement data.

    • ponifile (str): A string for poni file usage.

    • interpolation_q_range (tuple or None, optional): A tuple (q_min, q_max) specifying the range of q values for interpolation, where q is the momentum transfer, in reciprocal nanometers. If not provided, the full q range will be used.

    • azimuthal_range (tuple or None, optional): A tuple (min_deg, max_deg) specifying the range of degrees for integration. Degrees are in a range from -180 to 180.

  • npt (int) – Number of points for integration. Defaults to 256.

  • mask (array_like) – Mask array to be applied during integration. 1s are for pixels to be masked, 0s for pixels to be integrated. Defaults to None.

  • mode (str) – Mode of integration. ‘1D’ for 1-dimensional integration and ‘2D’ for 2-dimensional integration. Defaults to ‘1D’.

  • calibration_mode (str) – Mode of calibration. ‘dataframe’ is used when calibration values are columns in the dataframe, ‘poni’ is used when calibration is in a poni file. Defaults to ‘dataframe’.

  • poni_dir (str or None) – Directory path containing .poni files for calibration. Only applicable when calibration_mode is set to ‘poni’. Defaults to None.

Returns:

  • numpy.ndarray: The array of radial q values (momentum transfer) resulting from the integration.

  • numpy.ndarray: The intensity values resulting from the integration.

  • numpy.ndarray, optional: The array of azimuthal angles (radians) for 2D integration, returned only if mode is ‘2D’.

Containers¶

class MLBlindContainer(model_name: str, wavelength: int, pixel_size: int, faulty_pixel_array: array, fill_method: str, filter_size: int, n_clusters: int, z_score_threshold: float, direction: str, clusters: Dict[int, MLClusterBlind])¶

Bases: object

Container for holding multiple MLClusterBlind instances.

Parameters:

  • model_name (str) – The name of the model.

  • wavelength (int) – The wavelength used in the analysis.

  • pixel_size (int) – The pixel size used in the analysis.

  • faulty_pixel_array (np.ndarray) – Array of faulty pixel coordinates.

  • fill_method (str) – The method used for filling missing data.

  • filter_size (int) – The size of the filter used.

  • n_clusters (int) – The number of clusters.

  • z_score_threshold (float) – The threshold for Z-score based outlier removal.

  • direction (str) – The direction of outlier removal.

  • clusters (Dict[int, MLClusterBlind]) – Dictionary of MLClusterBlind instances.

class MLCluster(df: DataFrame, q_range: ndarray, q_cluster: int, normalizer: Normalizer = None, std: StandardScaler = None, model: XGBClassifier | RandomForestClassifier = None, accuracy: float = 0, roc_auc: float = 0, X_test: ndarray = None, y_test: ndarray = None, train_func: Callable = None, important_features: array = None, model_reduced: XGBClassifier | RandomForestClassifier = None)¶

Bases: object

Stores information about a machine learning cluster.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing the data.

  • q_range (np.ndarray) – The q-range of the cluster.

  • q_cluster (int) – The cluster label.

  • normalizer (Normalizer, optional) – The normalizer used for the data, defaults to None.

  • std (StandardScaler, optional) – The standard scaler used for the data, defaults to None.

  • model (Union[XGBClassifier, RandomForestClassifier], optional) – The machine learning model, defaults to None.

  • accuracy (float, optional) – The accuracy of the model, defaults to 0.

  • roc_auc (float, optional) – The ROC AUC score of the model, defaults to 0.

  • X_test (np.ndarray, optional) – Test features, defaults to None.

  • y_test (np.ndarray, optional) – Test labels, defaults to None.

  • train_func (Callable, optional) – Function used to train the model, defaults to None.

  • important_features (np.ndarray, optional) – Array of important features, defaults to None.

  • model_reduced (Union[XGBClassifier, RandomForestClassifier], optional) – The reduced machine learning model, defaults to None.

calc_accuracy(reduced=False)¶

Calculates the accuracy of the model.

Parameters:

reduced (bool, optional) – Whether to use the reduced model, defaults to False.

calc_roc_auc(reduced=False)¶

Calculates the ROC AUC score of the model.

Parameters:

reduced (bool, optional) – Whether to use the reduced model, defaults to False.

model_train(**kwargs)¶

Trains the model using the provided training function.

Parameters:

**kwargs – Additional arguments for the training function.

predict(reduced=False)¶

Predicts the class for each sample.

Parameters:

reduced (bool, optional) – Whether to use the reduced model, defaults to False.

predict_proba(reduced=False)¶

Predicts the probability of the positive class for each sample.

Parameters:

reduced (bool, optional) – Whether to use the reduced model, defaults to False.

Sets the DataFrame for the cluster.

class MLClusterBlind(q_range: ndarray, normalizer: Normalizer, std: StandardScaler, model: XGBClassifier | RandomForestClassifier, accuracy: float, roc_auc: float, important_features: array = None, model_reduced: XGBClassifier | RandomForestClassifier = None)¶

Bases: object

Stores information about a machine learning cluster for blind data.

Parameters:

  • q_range (np.ndarray) – The q-range of the cluster.

  • normalizer (Normalizer) – The normalizer used for the data.

  • std (StandardScaler) – The standard scaler used for the data.

  • model (Union[XGBClassifier, RandomForestClassifier]) – The machine learning model.

  • accuracy (float) – The accuracy of the model.

  • roc_auc (float) – The ROC AUC score of the model.

  • important_features (np.ndarray, optional) – Array of important features, defaults to None.

  • model_reduced (Union[XGBClassifier, RandomForestClassifier], optional) – The reduced machine learning model, defaults to None.

class MLClusterContainer(model_name: str, clusters: Dict[int, MLCluster])¶

Bases: object

Container for holding multiple MLCluster instances.

Parameters:

  • model_name (str) – The name of the model.

  • clusters (Dict[int, MLCluster]) – Dictionary of MLCluster instances.

DB Download¶

This file includes functions and classes essential for dealing with EosDX DB for data extraction

class RequestDB(api_key: str, form: Dict[str, str], file_name: str, url: str, unzip_path: str | Path, dataset_name: str = 'data.json')¶

Bases: object

A dataclass to store essential information for requests to the server.

Parameters:

  • api_key (str) – The API key used for authentication.

  • form (Dict[str, str]) – A dictionary containing form data for the request.

  • file_name (str) – Name of the file where the data will be downloaded.

  • url (str) – The URL of the server. Defaults to a predefined URL.

  • unzip_path (Union[str, Path]) – The path where downloaded files should be unzipped. Defaults to a predefined path.

  • dataset_name (str) – Name to save the dataset as.

download_data(api_key: str, form: Dict[str, str], url: str, file_name: str)¶

Downloads the required data from the EOSDX DB.

Parameters:

  • api_key (str) – The API key as a string.

  • form (Dict[str, str]) –

    JSON-like dictionary representing the request form. See API.md for information.

    Example for cancer tissue data:

    form = {
    'key': 'your-access-key',
    'cancer_tissue': True,
    'measurement_id': '< 3',
    'measurement_date': '2023-04-07'
}

    Example for blind data:

    form = {
    'study': '2',  # 1 for California, 2 for Keele, 3 for mice data
    'key': key,
    'machine': '3',  # 1 for Cu, 2 for Mo in California, 3 for                 Keele
    'manual_distance': '160'
}

  • url (str) –

    The URL of the server.

    Example URLs:

    • URL_DATA = “https://api.eosdx.com/api/getmultiple”

    • URL_BLIND_DATA = “https://api.eosdx.com/api/getblinddata”

  • file_name (str) – Name of the file where the data will be downloaded.

form_df(unzip_path=PosixPath('unzipped_data')) → DataFrame¶

Generates a pandas DataFrame from the data downloaded using the EOSDX API.

Parameters:

unzip_path (Path) – The path where the downloaded data is extracted. Defaults to UNZIP_PATH if not provided.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the data.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

get_df(request: RequestDB) → DataFrame¶

Makes a request to the database using the provided RequestDB object and returns a pandas DataFrame.

Parameters:

request (RequestDB) – A RequestDB object containing essential information for the request.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the data retrieved from the database.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

monitor_elapsed_time(start_time, stop_event)¶

Monitors and prints the elapsed time in a separate thread.

Parameters:

  • start_time (float) – The start time of the operation.

  • stop_event (threading.Event) – Event object to signal the thread to stop.

save_df(df, path, dataset_name)¶

Saves the DataFrame as a pickle file.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – A pandas DataFrame containing the data.

  • path (Path) – The path where the file will be saved. Defaults to UNZIP_PATH if not provided.

  • dataset_name (str) – Filename to save the file as.

unzip_data(file_name: str, unzip_path: str)¶

Unzips data downloaded from the server to the specified folder.

Parameters:

unzip_path (Union[str, Path]) – The path where the data will be extracted. Defaults to UNZIP_PATH if not provided.

Transformers¶

The transformer classes are stored here

class AzimuthalIntegration(faulty_pixels: Tuple[int] = None, npt: int = 256, integration_mode: str = '1D', transformation_mode: str = 'dataframe', calibration_mode: str = 'dataframe', poni_dir_path: str = 'data/poni')¶

Bases: TransformerMixin

Transformer class for azimuthal integration to be used in an sklearn pipeline.

Parameters:

  • faulty_pixels (Tuple[int]) – A tuple containing the coordinates of faulty pixels.

  • npt (int) – The number of points for azimuthal integration. Defaults to 256.

  • integration_mode (str) – The integration mode, either “1D” or “2D”. Defaults to “1D”.

  • transformation_mode (str) – The transformation mode, either ‘dataframe’ (returns a DataFrame for further analysis) or ‘pipeline’ (to use in an sklearn pipeline). Defaults to ‘dataframe’.

  • calibration_mode (str) – Mode of calibration. ‘dataframe’ is used when calibration values are columns in the DataFrame, ‘poni’ is used when calibration is in a poni file.

  • poni_dir_path (str) – Directory path where .poni files for the rows will be saved.

fit(x: DataFrame, y=None)¶

Fit method for the transformer. Since this transformer does not learn from the data, the fit method does not perform any operations.

Parameters:

  • x (pandas.DataFrame) – The data to fit.

  • y – Ignored. Not used, present here for API consistency by convention.

Returns:

Returns the instance itself.

Return type:

object

transform(x: DataFrame) → DataFrame¶

Applies azimuthal integration to each row of the DataFrame and adds the result as a new column.

Parameters:

X (pandas.DataFrame) – The data to transform. Must contain ‘measurement_data’ and ‘center’ columns.

Returns:

A copy of the input DataFrame with an additional ‘radial_profile_data’ column containing the results of the azimuthal integration, and optionally ‘q_range’ and ‘azimuthal_positions’ columns for 2D integration.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

class Clusterization(n_clusters, z_score_threshold, direction)¶

Bases: TransformerMixin

Transformer class to perform clusterization and remove outliers from the DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • n_clusters (int) – The number of clusters to use in K-Means clustering.

  • z_score_threshold (float) – The threshold for Z-score based outlier removal.

  • direction (str) – The direction of outlier removal, either “both”, “positive”, or “negative”.

fit(x: DataFrame, y=None)¶

Fit method for the transformer. Since this transformer does not learn from the data, the fit method does not perform any operations.

Parameters:

  • x (pandas.DataFrame) – The data to fit.

  • y – Ignored. Not used, present here for API consistency by convention.

Returns:

Returns the instance itself.

Return type:

object

transform(df: DataFrame) → DataFrame¶

Transforms the input DataFrame by performing clusterization and outlier removal.

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – The input DataFrame.

Returns:

The transformed DataFrame with outliers removed.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

class InterpolatorClusters(perc_min: float, perc_max: float, resolution: int, faulty_pixel_array: List, model_names: str)¶

Bases: TransformerMixin

Transformer class for interpolating clusters of azimuthal integration data.

Parameters:

  • perc_min (float) – The minimum percentage of the maximum q-range for interpolation.

  • perc_max (float) – The maximum percentage of the maximum q-range for interpolation.

  • resolution (int) – The resolution for interpolation.

  • faulty_pixel_array (List) – A list of faulty pixel coordinates.

  • model_names (str) – Names of the models.

fit(x: DataFrame)¶

Fit method for the transformer. Since this transformer does not learn from the data, the fit method does not perform any operations.

Parameters:

  • x (pandas.DataFrame) – The data to fit.

  • y – Ignored. Not used, present here for API consistency by convention.

Returns:

Returns the instance itself.

Return type:

object

transform(df) → Dict[str, MLClusterContainer]¶

Perform interpolation on the input data.

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame containing data to be interpolated.

Returns:

Dictionary containing interpolated clusters.

Return type:

dict

Bases: TransformerMixin

Transformer class for normalizing and scaling clusters of azimuthal integration data.

Parameters:

  • model_names (List[str]) – Names of the models.

  • do_fit (bool) – Whether to fit the scaler. Defaults to True.

  • y – Ignored. Not used, present here for API consistency by convention.

Utilities¶

Various utility functions used in different parts of codebase

create_mask(faulty_pixels)¶

Creates a mask array to identify faulty pixels.

Parameters:

faulty_pixels (list of tuples or None) – List of (y, x) coordinates representing faulty pixels, or None.

Returns:

Mask array where 1 indicates a faulty pixel and 0 indicates a good pixel, or None.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray or None

generate_poni(df, path)¶

Generates .poni files from the provided DataFrame and saves them to the specified directory.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame containing calibration measurement IDs and corresponding .poni file content.

  • path (str) – Path to the directory where .poni files will be saved.

Returns:

Path to the directory where .poni files are saved.

Return type:

str

get_center(data: ndarray, threshold=3.0) → Tuple[float]¶

Determines the center of the beam in SAXS data.

Parameters:

  • data (np.ndarray) – The input SAXS data.

  • threshold (float, optional) – The threshold factor for identifying the center of the beam. Defaults to 3.0 times the average value of the input data.

Returns:

The coordinates of the center of the beam in the input data. If no center is found, returns (np.NaN, np.NaN).

Return type:

tuple

interpolate_cluster(df, cluster_label, perc_min, perc_max, azimuth)¶

Interpolates a cluster of azimuthal integration data.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame containing data to be interpolated.

  • cluster_label (int) – Label of the cluster to be interpolated.

  • perc_min (float) – The minimum percentage of the maximum q-range for interpolation.

  • perc_max (float) – The maximum percentage of the maximum q-range for interpolation.

  • azimuth (Callable) – A transformer to use for azimuthal integration.

Returns:

Interpolated MLCluster object.

Return type:

MLCluster

is_all_none(array)¶

Checks if all elements in the input array are None.

Parameters:

array (iterable) – Input array or iterable.

Returns:

True if all elements are None, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

is_nan_pair(pair)¶

Checks if the input is a tuple of two NaN values.

Parameters:

x (tuple or any) – Input to check.

Returns:

True if the input is a tuple of two NaN values, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

normalize_scale_cluster(cluster: MLCluster, std=None, norm=None, do_fit=True)¶

Normalizes and scales a cluster of azimuthal integration data.

Parameters:

  • cluster (MLCluster) – The cluster to be normalized and scaled.

  • std (StandardScaler or None, optional) – StandardScaler instance for scaling. If None, a new instance will be created. Defaults to None.

  • norm (Normalizer or None, optional) – Normalizer instance for normalization. If None, a new instance will be created. Defaults to None.

  • do_fit (bool, optional) – Whether to fit the scaler. Defaults to True.

remove_outliers_by_cluster(dataframe, z_score_threshold, direction='negative', num_clusters=4)¶

Removes outliers from a DataFrame by clustering and z-score thresholding.

Parameters:

  • dataframe (pd.DataFrame) – The input DataFrame containing the data.

  • z_score_threshold (float) – The threshold for Z-score based outlier removal.

  • direction (str, optional) – The direction of outlier removal, either “both”, “positive”, or “negative”. Defaults to “negative”.

  • num_clusters (int, optional) – The number of clusters to use. Defaults to 4.

Returns:

A DataFrame with outliers removed based on the specified criteria.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame
